item.itunes:author: Adam Curry

item.title: Daily Source Code for Friday March 14th 2008
item.description:
#733 Daily Source Code for Friday March 14th 2008

If I am only able to bring you one show in a particularly busy week, it darn well better be a Fubar Friday an I think I delivered today. 2 main topics to discuss: Why the hell haven't I been doing shows this week, what's going on? The answer comes in two parts... One is my road trip and some interesting mainstream media action, the other and most important is the focused strategy and direction PodShow has embarked on. I go into deep detail on our business model, where the money comes from and how you can get your hands on that stream of revenue as an independent producer of audio and video properties. Please don't get me wrong though, the show is like a freight train runnin' at breakneck speed, mainly thanks to the music, Sir Jersey Todd and the HitTest, all carefully selected for your listening pleasure.

Music in this episode:

Bruce Springsteen - Hungry Heart

Aggro1 - Hotel California vs San Francisco

Temple Of Soul - Sunshine In Your Smile

Sarah Vonderhaar - I Got Sunshine

All Crazy - Jungle juice

Delilah Why - Walk On By

Heres the DSC Demographicssurvey link

For lowest prices on domain names, check out theDSC GoDaddy couponsyou can use for the best discount anywhere.

Now available exclusively through PodShow, a15% discounton the Nokia N810 Internet Tablet. Check out my promo codes and coupon page links. \nDuration: 01:06:05

item.title: Daily Source Code for Monday February 25th 2008
item.description:
#729 Daily Source Code for Monday February 25th 2008

Another Live DSC from the Curry Condo in NoCal for your enjoyment. I feel like we're really hitting our stride now, even though I didn't bring many of you into the conversation , just the fact that I can 'see' a live audience really motivates and energizes my own performance. Besides the promised talk about theUK anti-terror campaignthat Parky alerted me too I also get into the time saving benefit of using Safari over FireFox on my mac, review the Oscars 'shark jump' and of courseOPSOLhelps us all rewind our mind with some awesome tracks from the soundtrack of our lives.

Music in this episode:

Madness - It Must be Love
Herman's Hermits - Don't Know Much About History

#726 Daily Source Code for Wednesday February 20th 2008

The 'Batteries Not Included' episode of the DSC is once again one for the history books. I feel that the 'live' aspect is working well. Almost real-time reports of the missleblowingthe sattelite out of space as well as the meteor strike in Washington state. Some great calls about the state of the nations Uk and USA (patriotic stuff here) and an invite to get thrown in jail for a night on 'the rock'. Add to that some kick ass tunes and Miss Something from brooklyn, who got stood up on a booty call.....

#725 Daily Source Code for Monday February 18th 2008

Today marks a new era in the DSC format. I finally came up with a satisfactory configuration for my setup so I can take calls on TalkShoe without any of the crackling and other extraneous audio hiccups. Of course one tweet got the conference call filled with about 25 people within seconds. Not a lot to talk about, athough Jay from Philly walked me through some good geeky pilot stuff. Couple voice mails (kinky!) and some great tunes...

item.title: Daily Source Code for Friday February 08th 2008
item.description:
#720 Daily Source Code for Friday February 8th 2008

Fubar Friday's on the Daily Source Code are typically compiled of great music to get the weekend started with. Although today is no exception, we run a bit long due to two major rants: The British Surveillance Society (The Snoop Dogg Nation) and three reports on the Homeland Security Administration. The first is the TSAweblog, who admitted this week that they were at fault in San Francisco forrequiringall electronic gadgets to be removed from hand luggage. The second is the EFF'slawsuitagainst the Customs and Border Protection agency, who did not respond on time to a Freedom of information request. ThePDFof the suit is a fantastic read and you can see my story all over it. Finally, and perhaps the most frightening is the apparent arming of the TSA with small side weapons as is made clear by theirrecent purchaseof small arms simulators.

Music in the show today from:

JTX - PArty Like A Rockstar
Stranglers - No More Heroes
Big Head Todd And The Monsters - Her Own Kinda Woman
Lady Synful - My City
EBA vs Carpenters - Young I Was
Paul Melancon - Tell It To The Bees
Coolio - Sunshine

For lowest prices on domain names, check out theDSC GoDaddy couponsyou can use for the best discount anywhere.

item.title: Daily Source Code for Thursday January 24th 2008
item.description:
#713 Daily Source Code for Thursday January 24th 2008

Life is nuts! I'm in San Francisco again for a few days and to add to the confusion I've left he Vaio and CastBlaster in the UK, trying out a new mobile setup that is mac based. We all know that could potentially lead to trouble :)

It's an early morning show (6am) but filled with everything the typical middle-class middle aged dude would like (heh)

Music in the show today from:

item.title: Daily Source Code for Thursday January 17th 2008
item.description:
#710 Daily Source Code for Thursday January 17th 2008

Finally the codes are in for a special 15% discount to all Charlie heads who want to pick up the Nokia N810 internet tablet! Today I don't just hawk it to you, but show you an awesome application to use with your N810. LogMeIn(screenshothere) is a remote desktop service that is browser based, works on the tablet, and is free, as in beer :) To purchase the N810 at a 15% discount, check out mypromo and coupon code pagehere on curry.com. If you do purchase one (using my code dailysourcecode) call me and let me know!

Then we move into some PodSafe Music banter about packaging and the demise of the music industry as we know it.

item.title: Daily Source Code for Wednesday December 12nd 2007
item.description:
#699 Daily Source Code for Wednesday December 12th 2007

I was once again very disappointed as a United States citizen upon arrival at 'Liberty' airport in Newark NJ for a quick week of meetings in New York City. It is now abundantly clear that the 'Automatic Targeting System' of the Treasury Enforcement Computer System is showing sufficient 'points' to flag me for secondary screening upon entering the USA. It's called the 'Look Out List' and millions of Americans are on it, including yours truly. Details at the beginning of the show. Kinda took the wind out of me at the start of this trip to be honest. Vote for Ron Paul before I get sent to Gitmo!

Music In This Episode:

The Michael E Thomas Band - Going To New York City
Adam Sandler - The Chanuka Song Part 3
Duran Duran - Falling Down

It's called the 'Look Out List' and millions of Americans are on it, including yours truly. Details at the beginning of the show. Kinda took the wind out of me at the start of this trip to be honest. Vote for Ron Paul before I get sent to Gitmo!

Music In This Episode:

The Michael E Thomas Band - Going To New York City
Adam Sandler - The Chanuka Song Part 3
Duran Duran - Falling Down

item.title: Daily Source Code for Friday November 30 2007
item.description:
#694 Daily Source Code for Friday November 30th 2007

From The Curry Condo, San Francisco, Ca. USA

All elements needed came together magically for our friday festivities. I think I just about managed to cram three days worth of stuph into this show, wrapping up the third week in a month that I've been in the Bay Area.

Answers to the TiVoCast questions, a history lesson about the start of the second world war and a new theory on the defunct iPhone reception in the UK.

To the folks who called in about the global availability of the PodShowNokia N810offer, your questions are also answered in this episode. Sheet, I guess you'll have to listen to find out :)

Feedback on the newSony Headphones, The V3 Release, Jan Polet's video hittest, "Take A Red Pill - Vote For Ron Paul"and a visit from Sir Jersey Todd complete this 50 minute package of love.

Music In This Episode:

Soil- Black Betty

item.title: Daily Source Code for Thursday November 08th 2007
item.description:
#683 Daily Source Code for Thursday November 8th 2007

From The Curry Condo, San Francisco, California USA

What the heck is goin' on in the world?? Seven countries are at minimumconsideringdivesting of the US Dollar, the Lawyer's Guild isimpeachingBush and Cheney, all our wars are executed by private companies. Thank goodness for my Mac and Bangin' With Butler, without such luxuries in life it just woudn't be worth it :) If you are listening to this show on your computer, please watch thisslide show of Iran. This is what our president wants to bomb. Tragic. George Carlinto the rescue!

#643 Daily Source Code for Wednesday August 1st 2007

From The Curry Manor, Guildford, UK.

The Charlie returns with a humpday recap of the last 24 hrs, which involved uncharictaristic drinking on my part, and some very interesting media meetings in London. And stop the bloody presses! Super Savant Roger Smalls is back with a vengance, and he's got a mind bender of a comment for us. Some cheddar chatter is to be expected, if you're into organizing the vast quantities of media you consume, then you'll like our channels. The aussies defend their honour against the kiwis and we finish with a new entry to the soundtrack of our lives.

item.title: Daily Source Code for Thursday July 19th 2007
item.description:
#637 Daily Source Code for Thursday July 19th 2007

From The Curry Manor, Guildford, UK.

The Revolution gains another HUGE win as the mainstream media bubble is bursting in the UK, indicating the business of radio and television is coming apart at the seams. Listen as I tell you some of my secret deception of the viewing public in my career and a spectacular interview with Michael Grade of ITV and long time television producer David Cox and you will be amazed that this has been going on for decades.

Our time and chance is now. We need to fan the flames and expose the American equivalent(s) of these scams to selfishly promote our own agenda of independent alternative media.

Make sure your friends hear this episode of the Daily Source Code, and encourage those with a story to tell to step forward as I am doing.

Pod People Taking Over!

item.title: Daily Source Code for Wednesday July 04th 2007
item.description:
#628 Daily Source Code for Wednesday July 4th 2007

From The Curry Manor, Guildford, UK.

Welcome to the world's largest fourth of July back yard picnic and barbecue! It's a special day for America as we celebrate our birth as an independent nation with all our inalienable rights. How I, and we feel as Americans is summed up perfectly in the collection of music I have for you're listening pleasure on today's episode of the Charlie. Fuck Yeah America! The Organization for Preservation of the Soundtrack of Our Lives has approved the public performances of today's music as 'fair use', Our party is no different than anyone else's boombox at a picnic, we're just a bigger party. Pass the hot dogs!

Brand New: The Season Finale ofPort City PD

Visit The PodShowSuckless Zone


Music in this episode:

Bree Noble - The Star Spangled Banner
Jesta - Independence Day

Billy Joel - We Didn't Start The Fire

James Brown - Livin' In America

#591 Daily Source Code for Monday April 30th 2007

From The Curry Manor, Guildford, UK

Is SoundExchange (and by proxy the RIAA) a danger to the PodSafe Music license and other alternative forms of licensing? DailyKosthinks it is, but as always there's lots of ways to interpretthe data. A call-out to Savants from the legal field who can help. Of course it isn't all serious business on the Cha-Cha, we talk aboutalternativeheadphonesand sulk over theshowgirls. It's a good day!

item.title: Daily Source Code for Monday April 23rd 2007
item.description:
#586 Daily Source Code for Monday April 23d 2007

From Curry Manor, Guildford, UK.

The big 2007 vacation wrap up with details of the acute case of 'headphone earlobe' and other notable events of the past week. Also a format change for the show, as I want to start doing [short, yet unedited] calls with some of the Savants as well as other folks who are experts in their field, but perhaps not slick enough to deliver the typical mainstream media soundbite or analysis. We kick this off with a chat with one of our own Savants with a conversation about the European Union directive on inter-country roaming charges and the French elections.

New Geoff Smith and a suprise entry from Warner Brothers on the PMN are also included.

Music in this episode:
Geoff Smith - Set The Music Free
Plan B - Not Good

#580 Daily Source Code for Thursday April 12th 2007

From Curry Manor, Guildford, UK.

Back home again, with two more shows before we head off on vacation. So, spanish lessons are inorder, as well as a wrap up on a couple threads. A special and exclusive unplugged performance from Pete Townshend on the show as well as some good old fashioned Finnish Porn.

Links:
Renewing the vows

Music in this episode:
Annex - You Brought It On Yourself
Pete Townshend Unplugged and Unleashed fromIn The Attic

Anji BeesUnwind , sponsored by Tylenol PM


Call or VoIp the VoiceMail line anytime:

+1201 625 6357or +44 207 681 3753


Dig me: adam.podshow.com
\nDuration: 00:47:23

From The Curry Condo, San Francisco, Ca. USA

item.title: Daily Source Code for Friday August 13rd 2004
item.description:
While on vacation in Sorrento Italy, I was inspired by two audio files my download script had 'plopped' onto my iPod. One was an edition of IT Conversations from OSCON, where Robert Lefkowitz discussed the meaning of source code. The other 'program' was Dave Winer's morning coffee notes about the debates between bloggers and journalists.

Today marks the first episode of the Daily Source Code, available through it's own rss feed as an enclosure.\nDuration: 00:22:37
item.author: Adam Curry
item.itunes:subtitle: Daily Source Code for Friday August 13rd 2004
